newsitem.title: JAPAN: Bargain-hunting lifts Oriental Land in morning.
newsitem.headline: Bargain-hunting lifts Oriental Land in morning.

text.p: Bargain-hunting lifted shares in Oriental Land Co Ltd, the operator of Tokyo Disneyland, in Wednesday morning trade, brokers said, after the issue fell for four consecutive sessions.
At 0043 GMT, the shares were up 100 yen at 8,200 yen.

A major shareholder of Oriental Land, Keisei Electric Railway Co Ltd, also rebounded after being battered by loss-cutting sales in previous days. The shares were up 17 yen at 800 yen, on trade of 1.174 million shares.
It was the 13th most heavily traded issue on the first section of the Tokyo bourse.
